quote: Despair is the price one pays for self-awareness. Look deeply into life, and you'll always find despair.
author: Irvin D. Yalom,  When Nietzsche Wept

quote: Despair is typical of those who do not understand the causes of evil, see no way out, and are incapable of struggle.
author: Vladimir Lenin

quote: Don't despair: despair suggests you are in total control and know what is coming. You don't - surrender to events with hope.
author: Alain de Botton

quote: It is not despair, for despair is only for those who see the end beyond all doubt. We do not.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien,  The Fellowship of the Ring

quote: Despair is the price one pays for setting oneself an impossible aim. It is, one is told, the unforgivable sin, but it is a sin the corrupt or evil man never practices. He always has hope. He never reaches the freezing-point of knowing absolute failure. Only the man of goodwill carries always in his heart this capacity for damnation.
author: Graham Greene

quote: The most common form of despair is not being who you are.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Despair is for people who know, beyond any doubt, what the future is going to bring. Nobody is in that position. So despair is not only a kind of sin, theologically, but also a simple mistake, because nobody actually knows. In that sense there is always hope.
author: Patrick Curry,  Defending Middle-Earth: Tolkien: Myth and Modernity

quote: Life begins on the other side of despair.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: But what we call our despair is often only the painful eagerness of unfed hope.
author: George Eliot

quote: what we call our despair is often only the painful eagerness of unfed hope.
author: George Eliot,  Middlemarch

quote: Bursts of hope make despair harder to live with.
author: Bethany Griffin,  Masque of the Red Death

quote: There is no despair so absolute as that which comes with the first moments of our first great sorrow, when we have not yet known what it is to have suffered and be healed, to have despaired and have recovered hope.
author: George Eliot

quote: Panicky despair is an underrated element of writing.
author: Dave Barry

quote: Is despair wrong? Isn’t it the natural condition of life after a certain age? … After a number of events, what is there left but repetition and diminishment? Who wants to go on living? The eccentric, the religious, the artistic (sometimes); those with a false sense of their own worth. Soft cheeses collapse; firm cheeses endurate. Both go mouldy.
author: Julian Barnes,  Flaubert's Parrot

quote: It's not the despair, Laura. I can take the despair. It's the hope I can't stand. ~ Brian Stimpson, Clockwise
author: John Cleese

quote: Despair is a free man--hope isa slave.
author: L.M. Montgomery,  The Blue Castle

quote: When we have reached the depths of despair, only then can we look up and see the light of hope.
author: Stephen Richards

quote: Just as despair can come to one only from other human beings, hope, too, can be given to one only by other human beings.
author: Elie Wiesel

quote: If you start in the pit of despair with these profane, awful things, even a glimmer of hope or awareness is going to occur that's much brighter coming from this dark, awful beginning.
author: Chuck Palahniuk

quote: No one should ever despair because the entrance to his or her chosen career path is clogged. There is an ancient saying: "The persistent drip wears through stone.
author: Kentetsu Takamori,  Something You Forgot...Along the Way: Stories of Wisdom and Learning

quote: It is almost as if happiness is an acquired taste, like coconut cordial or ceviche, to which you can eventually become accustomed, but despair is something surprising each time you encounter it.
author: Lemony Snicket,  The End

quote: Wherever the hope of glory lives, hopelessness passes away.
author: Nadine C. Keels,  The Song of Nadine

quote: She wondered that hope was so much harder then despair.
author: Patricia Briggs,  Cry Wolf

quote: Absence from whom we love is worse than death, and frustrates hope severer than despair.
author: William Cowper

quote: But hope, I can tell you, is an exhausting emotion; perhaps, along with fear, the most exhausting of all. It is like juggling eggs: the hope is the shell, and inside is despair. A single crack and the despair might spill everywhere, stain everything.
author: Sam Taylor

quote: He who hears the rippling of rivers in these degenerate days will not utterly despair.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The artist's job is not to succumb to despair but to find an antidote for the emptiness of existence.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Reality is, Hope and Despair lie in the same places. And they're just a matter of perspective.What changed my perspective, was her.
author: Richie Singh,  Chasing Butterflies

quote: With optimism, you look upon the sunny side of things. People say, 'Studs, you're an optimist.' I never said I was an optimist. I have hope because what's the alternative to hope? Despair? If you have despair, you might as well put your head in the oven.
author: Studs Terkel

quote: But hope is no less realistic than despair. It is still our choice whether to live in light or lie down in darkness.
author: Rick Yancey,  The Isle of Blood

quote: That is the challenge Companion. To take what has happened to you and learn from it. Nothing is quite so destructive as pity, especially self-pity. No event in life is so terrible that one cannot rise above it.
author: Robin Hobb,  Ship of Destiny

quote: Guilt starts as a feeling of failure.
author: Frank Herbert

quote: Disappointment is a sort of bankruptcy - the bankruptcy of a soul that expends too much in hope and expectation.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: To hope for nothing, to expect nothing, to demand nothing. This is analytical despair.
author: James Hillman,  Suicide and the Soul

quote: Here is the tragedy: when you are the victim of depression, not only do you feel utterly helpless and abandoned by the world, you also know that very few people can understand, or even begin to believe, that life can be this painful. There is nothing I can think of that is quite as isolating as this.
author: Giles Andreae

quote: The difference between hope and despair is a different way of telling stories from the same facts.
author: Alain de Botton

quote: It's a time of sorrow and sadness when we lose a loss of life.
author: George W. Bush

quote: Do not abandon yourselves to despair. We are the Easter people and hallelujah is our song.
author: Pope John Paul II

quote: Do you feel cold and lost in desperation? You build up hope, but failure’s all you’ve known Remember all the sadness and frustration And let it go. Let it go
author: Linkin Park

quote: The tragedy of this world is that no one is happy, whether stuck in a time of pain or joy.
author: Alan Lightman,  Einstein's Dreams

quote: Death, only, renders hope futile.
author: Edgar Rice Burroughs

quote: 'Pity without rigor would be cowardly egotism, mere sentimentality.'
author: Matthew Pearl,  The Dante Club

quote: But only a person in the depths of despair neglected to look beyond winter to the spring that inevitably followed, bringing back color and life and hope.
author: Mary Balogh,  A Matter of Class

quote: I think that humor is part of what saves us from despair.
author: John Perry Barlow

quote: He who despairs of the human condition is a coward, but he who has hope for it is a fool.
author: Albert Camus

quote: There's no such thing as perfect writing, just like there's no such thing as perfect despair.
author: Haruki Murakami,  Hear the Wind Sing

quote: Half the night I waste in sighs,Half in dreams I sorrow afterThe delight of early skies;In a wakeful dose I sorrowFor the hand, the lips, the eyes,For the meeting of the morrow,The delight of happy laughter,The delight of low replies.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson,  Maud, and other poems

quote: It is hope--with regard to our careers, our love lives, our children, our politicians, and our planet--that is primarily to blame for angering and embittering us. The incompatibility between the grandeur of our aspirations and the mean reality of our condition generates the violent disappointments which rack our days and etch themselves in lines of acrimony across our faces.
author: Alain de Botton,  Religion for Atheists: A Non-Believer's Guide to the Uses of Religion

quote: We are ready to despair too soon, we are ready to say, ‘What’s the good of doing anything?’ Hope is the virtue we should cultivate most in this present day and age.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Say I feel all sad and self-indulgent, then get stung by a wasp, my misery feels quite abstract and I long just to be in spiritual pain once more - 'damn you tiny assassin, clad in yellow and black, how I crave my former innocence where melancholy was my only trial'.
author: Russell Brand,  Articles of Faith
